ygData.subject: Re: making female friends
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, I trade off.  I find that when I am with people I ve just met, I tend to take the lead, but with my guildbrothers and a coupla others, I m content to
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, I trade off. I find that when I am with people I've just met, I tend to take the lead, but with my guildbrothers and a coupla others, I'm content to follow wiser (or more knowledgeable, at any rate) heads. =) It's situational, and I find most women are the same way when
our paths meet.

Sara, Povar server

Megan Huntsman wrote:

> From: "Megan Huntsman" <pixiest@...>
>
>
> --
>
> On Thu, 17 Jun 1999 07:35:10 Heather Hire wrote:
> >From: Heather Hire <hrootbeer@...>
>
> <snip>
>
> >only female in a group....it is interesting to note that I am usually
> >the group's leader by consent or default even if I don't invite all the
> >group members....do you think that is a female thing?
>
> It's funny you should say that because I'm almost always the group leader. I don't know if it has to do with age, sex or a mind for strategy though. And it's not like I seek the position, but I'm always the one telling others when to back out or heal or who we attack first etc.
>
> Pix
